paper.title: Stratified Default Theories
paper.abstract: Default logic is a nonstandard formal system, especially suitable for knowledge representation and commonsense reasoning. In this paper we study a class of propositional default theories for which computation of extensions simplifies. We introduce the notions of stratification and strong stratification. We investigate properties of stratified default theories. We show how to determine whether a given default theory is stratified or strongly stratified and how to find the finest partition into strata. We present algorithms for computing extensions for stratified default theories and analyze their complexity.
